intro: Stephania concinna, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a perennial climbing shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various alkaloids, some of which have medicinal properties. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both traditional medicine and ecological studies.
